summary: The America First Act aims to restrict eligibility for various federal benefits for non-citizens, including those with parole, DACA status, asylum, or temporary protected status, and those unlawfully present. It amends laws related to public benefits, healthcare (Medicaid, Medicare), education (Head Start, ESEA), housing, tax credits, and FEMA funding. The bill also includes provisions related to WIC, school meals, Community Development Block Grants, and tax-exempt organizations, focusing on verification of citizenship and restricting funding for services to non-citizens.
